Reviews.Title: “Hotel under complete refurbishment 1st March 2012, should be good for the visitors this summer”
Reviews.Author: G S
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were due to say here for a few days in early march, we got a good cheap transfer from Sabia airport for 50TL, Our driver who did not speak much English got out of the minibus to check out were our hotel was on foot, when he came back he got our luggage out and ushered us to a building that stood on a corner. We new it could not be this building as it was just a concrete shell, so we started looking at the other hotels close by. None were the Grand Savur, we went back to the shell to see a small sign with the words Hotel Grand Savur on it, our hearts sunk, after approaching a Turkish builder a representative of the hotel came out and explained that the hotel was under complete refurbishment and we were being transferred to the St Shopia (a hotel in the same company group). The transfer was fine and the rep of the Grand Savur could was extremely helpful. From what we saw every thing is being replaced with new and as said before it has taken back to just a concrete shell, new windows, doors and everything. If you go this summer you will be in a brand new hotel, so all of the previous comments about the rooms will no longer be relevant.

Reviews.Title: “two weeks stay”
Reviews.Author: Shahpour T
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Dirty, nothing works. Shwer wals were so stained, It grossed me out. towels were torn on corners. rooms very small. shower very dirty. after our room was cleaned, the old soap and was still left with out being replaced. from 4 outlets in room only one worked which TV was pluged to. you couldn't be on your laptop or charge your phone or ETC with out unplugging the TV. . very expensive . for same price hotels around there offered Sona, turkish bath and massage. staff expected to be tiped even for smallst requests. no room service. if you stay there, don't use drinks from the frige, cause you will pay 4 $ for bottle of water while you can get it from corner stor for 50 cents. smelly rooms and hall ways. internet was down 3 days cause of rain. . I will never recommand this hotel. the worst and most expensive for what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, easy reach of attractions.”
Reviews.Author: jhw_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter and was apprehensive after reading reviews, but found the hotel to be more than adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were not large but comfortable. Shower/toilet was ok and clean. Room was cleaned and tidied every day. Easy reach of all of Istanbuls attractions. Overall excellent value for the money we paid, would have no hesitation in staying again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a place to have great staff look no further.”
Reviews.Author: Wisakedjak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a five star hotel but are you really looking to spend all your time in your room. The location is in walking distance of attractions. In our first day we managed to walk to the grand Bazar, Spice Bazar, Blue Mosque and on to the palace from the hotel. Now the rooms are the average rooms of any three star hotel. I in no way came across the dirty rooms like other reviewers have mentioned. The bathrooms could use work. Everything works but they do look cheap. But the greatest thing about the hotel is the night staff they will go out of there way to help you. the young receptionist is both funny and very helpful. The bell boy is great for help if you can get someone to translate. Night manager helpful and willing to take time to just talk to you. Bar staff is great. If you are staying here take the time to talk to the bartender Farhod he is very friendly and more the helpful but mostly just chat with him while your having a drink. He and the rest of the night staff are definitely what make the hotel great to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet to Rest, Convenient to Tour Around, Helpful Staff in All Ways.”
Reviews.Author: JennyWongHK
Reviews.Content: As a female asian individual traveller, I stayed in Grand Savur Hotel between 31/1/09 and 3/2/09. It provided a very safe, clean, comfortable & quiet environment for me to rest after each day of fascinating but tired tour. Internet service keeping me in touch with my friends. The nearby transport, especially the tramway, is so convenient that I get on everyday to the 4 towers, old city, Grand Bazzar, Eminonu ferry dock, Spice Bazzar, Domabache Palace, Tasim square, the old defence wall.........It just took 10-20minutes to different spots. The hotel is in a central spot of shopping streets(5min. walk), restaurants & money exchange(4min walk), tram & bus stops(5min walk), Aquaduct(7min walk), Cami(6min walk), police station(2min walk). The staff team was helpful in every question I asked, arranging airport transfer............If Turkish bath is needed, it's just round the corner. To get a glimps of the local residencial area, take a 10 min walk to the Aquaduct. Grand Savur Hotel is a good choice. MANY THANKS TO THE STAFF TEAM OF GRAND SAVUR HOTEL and TOUR GUIDE BIRDAL OYMAK.

Reviews.Title: “enought for sleep and take a shower”
Reviews.Author: susanabessa
Reviews.Content: iÂ´ve been is grand savur in february the hotel is located in a quite street, is a family small hotel, the rooms are small too but clean, i think itÂ´s a good hotel not luxury, they talk very well french. the rooms have frigobar. the floor is in carpet....

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: yagkos
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel near major attractions in the golden horn. everything is clean and breakfast was good. u get TV in room and private bathroom. It is in the Russian section of the town which sounds a bit bizzare but it is not a problem. 15-20 min walking distance from the Grand Bazar

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Savur Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gencturk Cad. Sirvanizade Sok. no.19 | Sehzadebasi, Istanbul, Turkey
